BriefDescription: Count cache branch misprediction per instruction
Count cache branch misprediction
Link stack branch misprediction
Link stack branch misprediction
% Branches Taken
Completion stall due to a Branch Unit
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was routed to the crypto execution pipe and was waiting to finish
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load that missed the L1 and was waiting for the data to return from the nest
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a multi-cycle instruction issued to the Decimal Floating Point execution pipe and waiting to finish.
Stalls due to short latency decimal floating ops.
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was issued to the Decimal Floating Point execution pipe and waiting to finish.
Completion stall by Dcache miss which resolved off node memory/cache
Completion stall by Dcache miss which resolved on chip ( excluding local L2/L3)
Completion stall due to cache miss that resolves in the L2 or L3 with a conflict
Completion stall due to cache miss that resolves in the L2 or L3 without conflict
Completion stall by Dcache miss which resolved in L2/L3
Completion stall due to cache miss resolving missed the L3
Completion stall due to cache miss that resolves in local memory
Completion stall by Dcache miss which resolved outside of local memory
Completion stall by Dcache miss which resolved from remote chip (cache or memory)
Stalls due to short latency double precision ops.

Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a scalar instruction issued to the Double Precision execution pipe and waiting to finish. Includes binary floating point instructions in 32 and 64 bit binary floating point format.

Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a scalar multi-cycle instruction issued to the Double Precision execution pipe and waiting to finish. Includes binary floating point instructions in 32 and 64 bit binary floating point format.
Finish stall because the NTF instruction is an EIEIO waiting for response from L2
Finish stall because the next to finish instruction suffered an ERAT miss and the EMQ was full
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load or store that suffered a translation miss
Cycles in which the NTC instruction is not allowed to complete because it was interrupted by ANY exception, which has to be serviced before the instruction can complete
Completion stall due to execution units for other reasons.
Completion stall due to execution units (FXU/VSU/CRU)
Cycles in which the NTC instruction is not allowed to complete because any of the 4 threads in the same core suffered a flush, which blocks completion
Completion stall due to a long latency scalar fixed point instruction (division, square root)
Stalls due to short latency integer ops
Finish stall due to a scalar fixed point or CR instruction in the execution pipeline. These instructions get routed to the ALU, ALU2, and DIV pipes
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to branch mispred
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to Icache Miss and branch mispred
Instruction Completion Table other stalls
Cycles in which the NTC instruciton is held at dispatch for any reason
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to dispatch holds because the History Buffer was full. Could be GPR/VSR/VMR/FPR/CR/XVF
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to dispatch hold on this thread due to Issue q full, BRQ full, XVCF Full, Count cache, Link, Tar full
ICT_NOSLOT_DISP_HELD_OTHER_CPI
Dispatch held due to a synchronizing instruction at dispatch
the NTC instruction is being held at dispatch because it is a tbegin instruction and there is an older tbegin in the pipeline that must complete before the younger tbegin can dispatch
ICT_NOSLOT_IC_L2_CPI
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to icache misses that were sourced from the local L3
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to icache misses that were sourced from beyond the local L3. The source could be local/remote/distant memory or another core's cache
Instruction Completion Table empty for this thread due to Icache Miss
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a larx waiting to be satisfied
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load that hit on an older store and it was waiting for store data
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load that missed in the L1 and the LMQ was unable to accept this load miss request because it was full
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load instruction with all its dependencies satisfied just going through the LSU pipe to finish
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load that was held in LSAQ because the LRQ was full
Finish stall due to LRQ miscellaneous reasons, lost arbitration to LMQ slot, bank collisions, set prediction cleanup, set prediction multihit and others

MetricExpr: lmq_full_stall_cpi + st_fwd_stall_cpi + lhs_stall_cpi + lsu_mfspr_stall_cpi + larx_stall_cpi + lrq_other_stall_cpi

BriefDescription: Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load or store that was held in LSAQ because an older instruction from SRQ or LRQ won arbitration to the LSU pipe when this instruction tried to launch
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was an LSU op (other than a load or a store) with all its dependencies met and just going through the LSU pipe to finish
Completion stall of one cycle because the LSU requested to flush the next iop in the sequence. It takes 1 cycle for the ISU to process this request before the LSU instruction is allowed to complete
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a mfspr instruction targeting an LSU SPR and it was waiting for the register data to be returned
Completion LSU stall for other reasons
MetricExpr: lsu_stall_cpi - lsu_fin_stall_cpi - store_finish_stall_cpi - srq_stall_cpi - load_finish_stall_cpi + lsu_stall_dcache_miss_cpi - lrq_stall_cpi + emq_stall_cpi - lsaq_stall_cpi

BriefDescription: Completion stall by LSU instruction
Completion stall because the ISU is updating the register and notifying the Effective Address Table (EAT)
Completion stall because the ISU is updating the TEXASR to keep track of the nested tbegin. This is a short delay, and it includes ROT
Completion stall because the ISU is updating the TEXASR to keep track of the nested tend and decrement the TEXASR nested level. This is a short delay
Number of cycles the Instruction Completion Table has no itags assigned to this thread
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was one that must finish at dispatch.
Cycles in which the oldest instruction in the pipeline (NTC) finishes. This event is used to account for cycles in which work is being completed in the CPI stack
Completion stall due to ntc flush
The NTC instruction is being held at dispatch because it lost arbitration onto the issue pipe to another instruction (from the same thread or a different thread)
The NTC instruction is being held at dispatch because there are no slots in the DARQ for it
The NTC instruction is being held at dispatch during regular pipeline cycles, or because the VSU is busy with multi-cycle instructions, or because of a write-back collision with VSU
Cycles unaccounted for.
Completion stall for other reasons
MetricExpr: stall_cpi - ntc_disp_fin_stall_cpi - ntc_flush_stall_cpi - lsu_stall_cpi - exec_unit_stall_cpi - bru_stall_cpi

BriefDescription: Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a paste waiting for response from L2
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was issued to the Permute execution pipe and waiting to finish.
Run cycles per run instruction
Run_cycles
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was awaiting L2 response for an SLB
Finish stall while waiting for the non-speculative finish of either a stcx waiting for its result or a load waiting for non-critical sectors of data and ECC
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a store that was held in LSAQ because the SRQ was full

MetricExpr: store_data_stall_cpi + eieio_stall_cpi + stcx_stall_cpi + slb_stall_cpi + tend_stall_cpi + paste_stall_cpi + tlbie_stall_cpi + store_pipe_arb_stall_cpi + store_fin_arb_stall_cpi

BriefDescription: Completion stall due to store forward
Nothing completed and Instruction Completion Table not empty
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a stcx waiting for response from L2
Finish stall because the next to finish instruction was a store waiting on data

Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a store waiting for a slot in the store finish pipe. This means the instruction is ready to finish but there are instructions ahead of it, using the finish pipe
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a store with all its dependencies met, just waiting to go through the LSU pipe to finish

Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a store waiting for the next relaunch opportunity after an internal reject. This means the instruction is ready to relaunch and tried once but lost arbitration
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a tend instruction awaiting response from L2
Completion Stalled because the thread was blocked
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a tlbie waiting for response from L2
Vector stalls due to small latency double precision ops
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a vector instruction issued to the Double Precision execution pipe and waiting to finish.

Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a scalar multi-cycle instruction issued to the Double Precision execution pipe and waiting to finish. Includes binary floating point instructions in 32 and 64 bit binary floating point format.
Completion stall due to a long latency vector fixed point instruction (division, square root)
Vector stalls due to small latency integer ops
Finish stall due to a vector fixed point instruction in the execution pipeline. These instructions get routed to the ALU, ALU2, and DIV pipes
